articles.title: How is AI impacting and defining the communications industry?

articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is redefining the landscape of corporate communication, public relations, and crisis management. At afaqs! Communicon, industry leaders engaged in a panel discussion on future-proofing communication through AI and technology. The panelists acknowledged that AI has transitioned from a futuristic concept to a powerful force actively reshaping corporate communications.

articles.title: Can artificial intelligence chatbots outperform human doctors? Here's what new Stanford study found
articles.author: KGO
articles.summary: Stanford University studies show that AI defeated human doctors at both diagnosing illnesses and reasoning through tough decisions. Dr. Chen is the faculty director for medical education in AI. He spoke to ABC7 News anchor Kristen Sze on Thursday at 3 p.m. on Thursday.

articles.title: Alibaba's Breakthrough AI Model Recognizes Human Emotions with High Accuracy
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Alibaba has developed an AI model capable of analyzing human emotions called R1-Omni. It is built on the OMNI-multimodal large language model and employs a Feedback learning technique with verifiable remuneration. It's a significant advancement in AI's ability to understand human emotions.

articles.title: 10 Kind of Freaky Ways AI is Changing the World
articles.author: Dédé Wilson
articles.summary: AI is not just about chatbots and personalized ads. It can do everything from creating art to diving into the deep sea. We explore ten unexpected ways AI is shaking things up across different industries. Get ready to be amazed-and maybe a little freaked out-by what this tech can do.

articles.title: Thread by @herbiebradley on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: Herbie Bradley has written a blog post about AI capabilities development. It's the first of two posts, the second covering the economic and political implications. AI will eventually diffuse widely, costs are falling and distillation and compression are powerful. Automated researchers are within sight and will accelerate progress over the next few years.

articles.title: Experts question if our mental capacity is eroding
articles.author: Claire Cameron
articles.summary: Teachers are worried about the impact of artificial intelligence on human cognitive development. Some people who use AI report that their critical thinking skills are eroding. Scores across reading, math, and science have dropped since 2012 in high-income countries, and adults also showed similar trends.

articles.author: Associated Press

It's the most visible sign of AI's inroads into healthcare, where hospitals are using increasingly sophisticated computer programs to monitor patients' vital signs, flag emergency situations and trigger step-by-step action plans for care.

The study was funded by the National Institute of Health and published in the scientific journal Cell on March 6. The device uses artificial intelligence to adjust to small changes in the brain that occur over time.

articles.title: AI and the PhD
articles.author: Murray Hunter
articles.summary: The advancement of artificial intelligence (AI) has already heavily impacted the credibility of the PhD or Doctorate of Philosophy. AI has long been used to assist students in undertaking literature searches, but now the technology is fully capable of creating a whole thesis in a matter of a few days. Some psychology and sociology-based research journal papers have been withdrawn and/or removed from journals, because the data was generated by AI. Ethical violations have been rising exponentially in the academic world of late. Some unscrupulous academics can make a lot of money from creating AI-generated PhDs.

articles.title: Apple's Perilous Catch-22: Navigating Its Own Tricky Dilemmas
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Sarah Chen is a leading tech analyst at Innovation Insights. She explains to Archyde how Apple's AI development and implementation of artificial intelligence (AI) has been delayed due to privacy concerns. Apple encrypts user data and keeps it on devices, but this limits their access to the datasets needed to train robust AI models. They can focus on smaller, local Large Language Models (LLMs) that run directly on the iPhone, or partnering with companies like OpenAI.

articles.title: 5 takeaways from HumanX: Here's how key speakers managed to look past the industry's hype

articles.summary: At HumanX in Las Vegas tech leaders talked about on AI's impact on business. Speakers like Kamala Harris emphasized collaboration between the tech industry and government. AI startups are fetching wild valuations, but the question is whether they're caught in a bubble that's set to burst.

articles.title: Baidu Releases Reasoning AI Model to Take On DeepSeek
articles.author: Bloomberg News
articles.summary: Baidu Inc. released a new artificial intelligence model that articulates its reasoning. Baidu's reasoning model excels in areas like daily dialogs, complex calculations and logical deduction. The Ernie X1 model works similarly to DeepSeek R1, which shocked Silicon Valley by offering comparable performance to the world's best chatbots at a fraction of their development cost. The company will make Ernie AI models open-source from June 30.

articles.title: Baidu Releases Reasoning AI Model to Take On DeepSeek
articles.author: Bloomberg News

Baidu's reasoning model excels in areas like daily dialogs, complex calculations and logical deduction. It also upgraded its flagship foundation model to Ernie 4.5.

articles.summary: Oliver Fiegel is a 47-year-old photographer based in Munich. He saw a front-page image of a boy chasing a football on a pitch in the German national Sunday newspaper that looked strangely off. AI's had the most devastating effect on the industry.

articles.title: AI Popular Myth Of Achieving Perfect AGI Versus Harsh Reality We Truly Face
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: There is a great deal of research going on to further advance AI. The general goal is to reach artificial general intelligence (AGI) or achieve artificial superintelligence (ASI). AI doomers believe AGI will wipe out humanity. AI accelerationists believe it will solve humanity's problems.

articles.title: Is AI The Secret Weapon To Help Stop Cyber Attacks?
articles.author: Kathleen Walch
articles.summary: In today's connected world, cyber threats are evolving at an unprecedented pace. Traditional cybersecurity measures struggle to keep up with the volume and complexity of modern threats. Companies are turning to AI to transform the way they detect, prevent, and respond to cyber risks. AI is helping to automate responses to threats, enabling faster mitigation and minimizing damage.

articles.title: The Future Of Education: Will AI Be The Great Equalizer?
articles.author: Cornelia C. Walther
articles.summary: By 2025, approximately 234 million school-aged children globally will experience disruptions to their education due to crises. Education is a cornerstone of individual and societal progress. AI-driven tools can personalize learning experiences, bridge gaps in educational access, and offer scalable solutions to improve literacy, numeracy, and lifelong learning.

articles.title: How AI Agents Are Helping Startups To Scale
articles.author: Alison Coleman
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) has become a fundamental part of business practice for startups and small businesses. Small businesses with 4-4.5 employees had the second-highest increase in AI usage since September 2023, only trailing corporations with 250 or more employees. AI adoption by those small businesses rose from 4.6% to 5.8%. Large corporations saw an increase from 5.2% to 7.8% in the same period.

articles.title: People Are Getting Brain Implants For BCI

articles.title: Cybersecurity officials warn against potentially costly Medusa ransomware attacks
articles.author: MATTHEW PERRONE
articles.summary: Ana is an artificial intelligence program created by Hippocratic AI. It's one of a number of new companies offering ways to automate time-consuming tasks usually performed by nurses and medical assistants. Many hospitals are using AI to monitor patients' vital signs, flag emergency situations and trigger step-by-step action plans for care. But nursing unions argue that this technology is overriding nurses' expertise and degrading the quality of care patients receive.
